intro: Synanthes borealis, commonly known as the northern synanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has a slender, upright stem with finely divided leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Synanthes borealis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
